column4: anyone had luck with a Nikon Coolpix l110?  I plug it in via USB and get nothing.
do you have an external storage card on the device you could use instead of plugging in the camera directly? i'm assuming you just want to transfer files?
yes, but that slot doesnt' seem to be working either.  tailing /var/log/syslog doesn't show anything helpful
is it a little sd card
it is.
lsmod | grep sd, please?
nothing, but the card is back in the camera at the moment
have you verified that the card is readable?
they show up on the camera's screen
ok so it's likely fine. would you plug it in to your pc? what version of ubuntu are you running?
by "it" i mean the sd card, not the camera. unless you want to set up the camera for some reason?
what gives you that error?
already installed
sudo apt-get install libgphoto2-2
and lsmod | grep sd is showing nothing.  I wonder if the card reader is broke.  It doesn't feel right
you've already done that?
it was already installed I guess before I sat down here tonihgt
could you try running that apt-get real quick anyway
libgphoto2-2 is already the newest version.
then try "sudo mount -a" & open nautilus
if "sudo mount -a" has odd output please pastebin it
i'm reading that people have luck rebooting with the sd card in the slot. it's not ideal but it could be a solution. also after reboot you can try "sudo su -l; echo 1 > /sys/bus/pci/rescan"
